reviews.review_msg: Krystal's class was unlike any other I've taken at SFU so far. Each class consists of a circle, mirroring restorative justice practices. The class requires a lot of participation and is not heavily focused on lectures. She brought in many guest lecturers, which really helped us to understand the theoretical material we were learning.

I took the course in the spring 2014. Dorota was so nice and helpful. Yes, you feel she is listening to you. I emailed her about my concern, she gave me advice and encouragement. Although it is an online course and I never have met her, I can feel her sincerity. She is a sweet person.
She is very helpful and nice. She is passionate about what she teaches.
One of the best TA's I've had! She's really friendly, and a fair marker. I would highly recommend her!

I thought this TA was pretty good.  She will go out of her way to help you, and seems to want to see people in the class do well.  This is not a good course to take by distance ed, but she does her best to help you learn and get through it.

Terrible TA who marks unfair and is very unhelpful. avoid at all costs. she didn't like me, so she gave me one percent lower than i needed for an A-. not amused. crim 315 is known to be a gpa boost class, but not in this case.

consists of a 30% individual Presentation/Paper, 10%  Participation, 30% Midterm, 30% Final...Rick is hilarious, makes class interesting.  HE LOVES JOKES  WIll tell jokes about his days as a officer and can relate well to students, would recommend this prof although his midterm can be hard but he goes out of his way to make sure no one will fail.

This prof is the most disrespectful, unhelpful, and ignorant person I have encountered in college, met with her 4 times to discuss a group project and asked for more guidance, she was so rude and made me feel so dumb. She threatened to take my group to the dean... She is so disrespectful and does not know how to teach. Avoid her at all costs.
she would give assignments which would be due the next day

One of the best classes I have taken in my undergrad. Colleen gives very clear instructions in what she expects, and provides detailed feedback in papers. She is very passionate in her work and in RJ. Lectures and tutorials were great.

I would take again. There is a weekly essay, but they are short (2-3 pages) and you hand them all in at the end of the month. If you follow the guidelines exactly you will get an A. Do not try to argue against her in papers. She is very warm and helpful if you see her one on one. Tutorials are so fun!
The course is really interesting and the topics are good, but the essays were a bit time consuming.

She's very knowledgable on restorative justice and the critical analysis papers every week are short and easy to write. She gives you the expectations and all you have to do is answer the questions and incorporate lectures, tutorials, and experiences. Must show up for tutorials but they are fun and not your usual tutorials. Would take again.
I loved the class and was really interested in RJ, however Colleen sucked as a prof. If it was not for the people in the class I would've never shown up. Do yourself a favour and do not take her!!!

This class requires a lot of work. Expect 2-3 hours of readings per week and a 3 page essay each week. Definitely not an easy class but tutorials are fun. Basically get 22% of your grade from showing up to tutorials and participating in games.
This lady does not know how to teach! If you're interested in learning about RJ take the courses with someone else.

Probably the worst class I have ever taken during my time at sfu. Her expectations for the essay are unreasonable. The essays are super time consuming. I thought I was going to enjoy this class but I absolutely hated it.
I don't recommend anybody to take RJ class with her. She is v v v hard marker.

Make sure that you spend lots of time on journal. Otherwise get ready to cry with your grades:( She does not provide enough feedback. The class is boring because she is heavily dependent on power-pints and scripts.
Very hard marker and rude.
Not recommended
CRIM-315 is a great course but never take this class with her. You will get completely wrong impression about RJ from her class.

Colleen is great! Engaged with the material and prioritizes student learning. Yes, she is "hard marker," as other students note, but this is a third year class and a certain level of knowledge is required to pass. Helpful feedback and good dialog. One of my favourite classes at SFU.
The instructor is really harming the  development of RJ. Her teaching style does not at all represent any RJ values. She thinks that she is 100% right and she is arrogant in expressing her opinion.

RJ is an important rethink to how criminal justice services are delivered in North America. However, Colleen presents a deeply one-sided and narrow view to RJ which intimidates students from voicing dissenting opinions. This causes tremendous animosity because she marks all the assignments which are worth 70% and so you can't risk offending her.

You will have to read all the material in order to write good journals. Be aware that she is very biased towards RJ so criticizing RJ will lose you marks. Even if you don't agree, just go with it if you want a good grade. She may seem a little abrasive but it's better to speak to her privately. The majority of the DVD videos are on Youtube!!

Colleen's firm take with all her students and her marking is quite opposite to the nature of RJ, in my opinion. Making this course as difficult as it is (deliberately adds extra reading material weekly in contrast to prev profs) is making the students hate the class.  If you truly care about RJ you should take this into consideration

Ironically, shes very uncompromising and demonstrates no care for students by rejecting all extreme circumstances (even if w/written proof) for missing tutorials.  Reads directly off notes in class. No improvemt since last sem's comments by students. Seems to thrive on marking hard & making things hard b/c she keeps smiling abt it.

Extremely unhelpful professor. She was very unclear about her instructions and seems to constantly contradict herself. Very hard marker but her comments on papers/journals are both misleading, unhelpful, and unreasonable. I would avoid her at all costs.

Nice lady, but not a good instructor. Her presentations are very dry, and she is a very hard marker as said before. Also she treats journal entries like term papers--you need to answer number of specific questions and have a intro/conclusion. That's quite a lot to cover in few pages don't you think? I would avoid this course if she is teaching it.
I noticed some of the comments were deleted. Anyways please don't take this personally, take its as a constructive criticism.

She is passionate but she tends to be defensive and oppressive to views that are against hers. She recognizes most students take 315 under the impression it will be a cake walk So she is very specific in her marking and tends to be extra critical. Guest speakers played an important role to her course because her lectures were difficult to endure.
Hard marker. Can get very defensive. Gives confusing instructions and often contradicts herself.
Hard marker and very defensive. Anyways its RJ so her classes will always be full. But just be careful. Its not a GPA booster class.

I suffered from a very boring lecture where she just reads from her notes! the only saving grace was her awesome guest speakers. Anyway the environment she created tends to force people to agree with her RJ principles Always needing people to say RJ works and stuff So people with opposite views are scared to voice otherwise. only as a last resort
Overall good teacher. You can tell she's really passionate about the material. Encourages interaction and participation, but is a hard marker!

Asad teaches this course with his passion, knowledge and experience. I've learned so much about RJ. So far, CRIM 315 is the best CRIM course I had at SFU! Definitely recommend anyone to take class with him. You will not regret!

Asad is very encouraging, kind and approachable. He is sometimes unclear with what he expects for assignments but after asking him questions he's very clear. Definitely recommend taking class with him if you ever get the opportunity to do so!
Asad is very approachable. Very helpful if you have questions. Different style teaching than most. He encourages conversation and discussion in lecture and tutorial

this guy is amazing and really cares about his students. his passion for RJ is incredible, which makes lecture engaging, and tutorials are a lot of fun! highly highly recommend anyone to take a class with him. you won't regret it.

Asad was my TA for CRIM 315. He is one of the nicest  people I have ever met. He made sure everyone was comfortable with any exercises we would do in our tutorial. He's also great at explaining to you what he expects from your paper. If you follow his basic guidelines, you will get a good grade for sure!

He is an absolutely amazing person and an even better teacher! Very patient, kind and understanding but expects the work to be done. He is incredibly helpful so really if you don't get a good grade it's because you didn't put the effort in! 100% recommend !!
I had great learning experience from his class. Strongly recommend students to take classes with Asad.
Great class! Really enjoyed tutorials and discussions.
I would recommend anybody to take class with him. Knowledgeable and passionate about restorative justice, provides details feedback and very helpful.
Provided excellent feedback whenever I needed. Excellent TA. Recommend anyone to take this RJ online course with Asad.
Asad is my favorite TA. He gives great and encouraging feedback in journals. He is passionate in the subject and really nice and cares about his students.
He is very knowledgeable and passionate about RJ. I had one of the best tutorials his class.

Asad was the best TA I've ever had. He really embodies the main principles and values of Restorative Justice and could not have done anything better. His tutorial discussion was thought-provoking. I always recommend to take CRIM 315 with him.
Prepared, helpful and knowledgeable. Had a great time with CRIM-135

Tania as a person was incredibly sweet. However, as an educator I found them very hard to get along with and understand. Instructions and lectures were unclear. Deadlines were missed. Criteria for assignments were nearly impossible to understand. I found this class very sloppy and not structured. Again great person! Their learning style isnt for me

Interesting lecturer - rambles a bit, but nothing unmanageable and lectures only apply a bit to the two papers you need to write anyway. Get ready to read a lot to truly understand restorative justice and for the papers. Papers allow you to pick your own focus. Tutorials and TAs were awesome! Tutorials are basically two hours of fun games.

One of the most caring profs at SFU. Very approachable and nice. T.A's were just as nice! I enjoyed learning about the RJ & doing worksheets on it weekly. Papers were super fun to write and tutorials were filled with new activities. There's no exams, which made it easier to learn. i would for sure take again!!!!

very passionate about RJ and showcases that through lectures, tutorials, and assignments. You don't have to show up to lecture, because there's no exams. There are 2 papers, worth 60%. There are weekly worksheets, but they are so much to do and basically free marks. Tutorials can be dragging, since it's 2 hours and filled with activities, but easy

Lectures and course materials hardly related to the two papers that make up 60% of the final grade. Tutorials are just two hours of icebreaker games with no reference to course material that can be used in assignments. Criteria for assignments are extremely vague and if they just don't like what you write, you'll lose marks.
Literally amazing teacher! Having her for 315, and she is so passionate about the topic its incredible. You actually want to be in her class.

Amazing TA. Really cares about her students and really wants to challenge them emotionally in this course. If you are scared to speak, this tutorial/class is NOT  for you because you are really pushed to your limits to share experiences in front of everyone. Tania makes it so comfortable though as if she is your friend - not your TA!

Tania was extremely unclear in her paper expectations, which was beyond frustrating. Her lectures were pointless to go to in that her slides merely covered the readings, without adding much else. That being said, way too much info on slides. Often would talk in circles, hence the lack of clarity. As a person, she is great. As a prof, not the best.

Tania failed to provide clear instructions. All Powerpoint were summarization from readings. Didn't add additional insight. Although Tania is an expert in RJ, she really dried it out for me, as RJ is something I am truly passionate about.
First.   Tania is amazing :)   True RJ prof, if anyone were to teach RJ she definitely qualifies for the job.  P.S. Would be friends with/date if wasn't my prof.
